sourceMeaningMnemonic: You use your <radical>fingers</radical> to hold the <radical>roof</radical> of the <radical>festival</radical> up, but it <kanji>rub</kanji>s against them. The roof is heavy, and you have to walk to keep up, so the roof is rubbing against them really, really badly.
meaningInfo: Have you ever been to a Japanese festival? There's always one of those portable shrines that are basically just roofs people hold up. That's what you're trying to hold with your fingers as the whole thing rubs against them.
readingMnemonic: Just when you thought the <kanji>rub</kanji>bing couldn't get worse, someone <reading>sat</reading> (<ja>さつ</ja>) down on the roof! AHG! It hurts!
readingInfo: Picture a very large person that decided to sat down right on top of the roof you've been carrying through the festival. The weight makes the rubbing so much worse, you can feel the skin coming off of your fingers.
